result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa K. Bridges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are due as follows: $10.00 is due on or before 08/01/2022 and then $10.00 is due by the first of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay may result in a commitment order to jail issued or a civil judgment entered for court ordered financial obligations. $15.00 payment plan fee added. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa K. Bridges

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant Lisa K. Bridges appeared by audio.  Attorney Peter Brian Kisken in court for Lisa K. Bridges.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim rights notices. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2, a straight disorderly conduct charge without weapons enhancer. Charge will be amended, weapons enhancer dismissed. Count 1 DRI. Defendant agrees and understands to appear remotely. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  She understood. Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. She understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Amended Count 2 Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1). Defendant did not exercise her right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: Court costs only

Court adopts the joint recommendation: Orders Court costs in the amount of $443.00. Pay at $10.00 month, first payment due on or before 8/1. Pay each month thereafter until paid in full. FTP may result in a commitment order to jail or civil judgment entered. 1 day jail credit. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:22 AM Defendant Lisa K. Bridges in court.  Attorney Peter Brian Kisken appeared by video for Lisa K. Bridges.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Adjourned to have defendant appear in person. AIA set for 5/2 @ 9 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Victim
Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
